'''''Amon Hen'' 3''' is the third issue of the [[Amon Hen (journal)|''Amon Hen'' journal]] by [[The Tolkien Society]].

==Contents==
: ''Note: All content is by John Martin unless otherwise indicated.''
* "The 1973 A.G.M." (Annual General Meeting)
* "The Name of the Slough Was Despond" (call for greater participation by Tolkien Society members)
* "''[[Mallorn (journal)|Mallorn]]'' 7" (call for papers)
* Letters by [[Jim Allen]], Susan Adler, Sue Hodgson, Gordon Larkin, Janet K. Gibbs, Jon Harvey, Pat McIntosh (Firiel), [[Hartley Patterson]], Miss P.E.M. Ward, Grahame Lamb, and Colin Dean
* "Junior Library Books to Borrow" by Rosie Turner (reviews of children's books)
** ''The Children of Green Knowe'' by L.M. Boston
** ''The Chimneys of Green Knowe'' by L.M. Boston
** ''Grimbold's Other World'' by Nicholas Stuart Gray
** ''Mainly in Moonlight'' by Nicholas Stuart Gray
** ''Carbonel'' by Barbara Sleigh
** ''The Kingdom of Carbonel'' by Barbara Sleigh
* List of Tolkien magazines and other fantasy-related fanzines
* "The North Farthing Smial" (meeting report)
* New members and changes of address
* Untitled poem by John Boardman ("Once bards earned their bed, board, and flagons")
